page.title: 01THE AREA AROUND RAMSBOTTOM.
page.content: The area is 16km.north of Manchester. It is a semi rural area rising to approximately 300m.and dominated by Holcombe Hill,on the top of which stands {Peel Tower}a monument to {Sir {Robert Peel.} The{landscape}of the area greatly influences how it is used by man and its economic development. Ramsbottom is the largest settlement of the area being situated in the valley of the river Irwell.Smaller settlements are found around Ramsbottom _ Hawkshaw,Holcombe Brook,Summerseat,and Greenmount,all of which are now purely residential. There is a large proportion of farmland in the area - especially on the valley sides. Since the building of the motorway,M66,the area is becoming a{commuter belt}.
